comments.text:
+Jholic91 Firstly, people aren't entitled to opinions or beliefs, they're 
entitled to information they can defend. If people were entitled to believe 
whatever they wanted we couldn't condemn people that had harmful ways of 
thinking, that eventually caused direct harm to self or others. Second, 
here is something that is not an opinion, it is a fact; English only 
speakers and people that grew up in American or non-Japanese culture only 
believe that there is more emotion in Japanese (or non English/first 
language) voice acting because they don't understand the tiny details about 
the culture themselves, nor the speech mannerisms, tone, inflection, etc. 
This means that your brain takes what it does know (the subtitles) and 
applies the other stuff that it does know to it (tone you understand, 
mannerisms you understand, inflection you understand, the stuff you don't 
get with subbed) and typically your brain will make it as enjoyable as 
possible. There is certainly no objective greater quality of voice acting 
just because of being Japanese, nor any more emotion just because of silly 
things like speaking louder or more intensely.
comments.author: Bailey Wooldridge

comments.text:
+trequor I said West the first time, I just made a mistake the second. And 
look, it's not the same thing as saying the Team RWBY members are all from 
Little Red Riding Hood. Because we know more about them already (and 
because the only female characters in that story are Red and Grandma, so it 
would really be impossible to assume that). And it's not unreasonable that 
some characters are based partially on multiple sources, or at least have a 
main source as well as borrowing from another. Like Pyrhha, she seems to be 
based mainly on Achilles and also borrow from the Amazons. It's not so 
outrageous to think that Neptune could be based both on Neptune (of myth) 
and the character Zhu Baije from Journey to the West. Both Neptune and Zhu 
have association with the sea, both are notorious flirts, and both have a 
brotherly relationship with Sun.

comments.text:
+Jester 5009 yeah, I think that was the point, since this show tries to 
subvert certain anime tropes

in most anime, the main female lead and the main male lead hook up. Here, 
jean (the closest we have to a male lead character

in most anime, if we have a girl for a lead, she must have a love interest. 
In this show, while ruby hasn't shown NO interest in the opposing sex, a 
true love interest for her hasn't stepped forward up until this point.

That displays that the writers have a remarkable confidence in their main 
character. They're confident that they don't have to rely on getting the 
fans "feels" bubbling with a forced romance, and that a woman doesn't need 
a man to be strong.

Now, if a love interest does present himself, it'll feel more natural 
(hopefully), because the writers spent time establishing her as an 
independent character, and now a romance can be a side benefit, rather than 
a hindrance

the characters were fully fleshed out, characterized, and consistent. 
Caboose was just a smart-mouthed inexperienced rookie, and not a 
fun-loving, energetic, and hilarious idiot.

were  apparently planned and made.

See... it's that sort of thing that makes you realized that a lot was 
already planned, even for the first few episodes. It's that sort of 
planning and work that you can easily come to appreciate, and makes for a 
consistent piece of work.

comments.text:
I understand if you don't like it, but don't call it trash, a ton of people 
like the art style and animation and are fine with things like the voice 
acting. Just say you don't like it, but if a ton of people do, then so be 
it. For example, I like Attack on Titan, and there are people that don't 
like it and call it trash. All I'm saying is that criticism is fine, but 
calling something trash is not criticism, it's just plain rude and 
disrespectful to the creators and the people that actually do like it. I

comments.text:
The naming of JNPR and RWBY is awesome.

RWBY itself is made up of the first letter of the names Ruby, Weiss, Blake 
and Yang.It is also made up of the first letter of the colours Red, White, 
Black and Yang. When pronounced phonetically it sounds like "Ruby". The 
characters on Team RWBY are all allude to certain fairy tales (Red Riding 
Hood, Snow White, Beauty and the Beast and Goldlilocks respectively) and 
each also has a connection to a flower (Roses. Myrtacea, Nightshade and 
Bell Peppers respectively) and each of those flowers are commonly found in 
the colour of their character. Furthermore all the colours that make RWBY 
are existing variants of roses.

JNPR when pronounced phonetically sounds like "Juniper" which is typically 
blue in colour. The characters on Team JNPR all reference, and are designed 
based on, figures in history or literature that are known to have 
cross-dressed. Jaune Arc is based on Joan of Arc. Pyrrha is potentially 
based on Achilles (as well as numerous figures in history going by the name 
of Pyrrha or Pyrrhus) whom once disguised himself as a woman and took the 
name "Pyrrha" Thor, off whom Nora is loosely based once disguissed himself 
as Goddess Freyja in order to infiltrate a fortress and steal Mjolnir. And 
Hua Mulan whom Lie Ren is loosely based also disguised herself as a man in 
order to serve in the army in her aging father's place. Each also alludes 
to a colour. Jaune is french for Yellow. Pyrrha has greek (latin?) origins 
and means "fire red" named after the red hair of Pyrrha from Greek 
mythology. Nora's name can be seen as short for Eleanora which means 
"Light" and Ren is Japanese for lotus which commonly come in the colours 
pink, white, blue or red. Given his aura colour it  may be considered that 
he references the pink lotus which is the supreme lotus.

Lastly: Rubies are red, junipers are blue, potentially referencing RvB 
where the two mains teams are Red Team and Blue Team.
comments.author: LuckyBullet
